SwcParser

An instance of SwcParser is made to parse SWC files with the given specification. The data output by this parser is a Javascript object representing a the tree structure of the morphology. Each node of the tree is a section that contain a reference to its parent section and references to its children sections. The tree is given flat, meaning all the sections are at the same hierarchy level within the JS object and every section is identified by an arbitrary ID.

new SwcParser()
Instance Members
▸ parse(swcStr)

Parses a SWC string. This SWC string is simply the text content of an SWC file. This method does not return any reult (use one of the getters for that)

parse(swcStr: String)
Parameters
swcStr (String) the string that comes from the SWC file
▸ getRawMorphology()

Get the raw morphology flat tree

getRawMorphology(): Object
Returns
Object: the soma and all the sections at the same level. Still, all the info about parent/children are present
▸ getMorphology()

Get the morphology object, which is much easier to query than the raw morphology

getMorphology(): morphologycorejs.Morphology
Returns
morphologycorejs.Morphology:

TreeNodeCollection

A TreeNodeCollection instance builds all the TreeNode instances from the raw points list from the SWC file. As a second step, it builds the parent/children relations between the nodes and as a third step, define a list of sections.

new TreeNodeCollection(points: Array)
Parameters
points (Array) every points of the array is itself an Array of form: [ pointId: Number, pointType: Number, x: Number, y: Number, z: Number, radius: Number, parentId: Number ]
Instance Members
▸ getRawMorphology()

Get the raw morphology flat tree

getRawMorphology(): Object
Returns
Object: the soma and all the sections at the same level. Still, all the info about parent/children are present

morphologycorejs.Morphology:

TreeNode

A TreeNode instance represent a point from the SWC file. It has a 3D coordinate, an ID, a type, a radius, a reference to a parent (which is also a TreeNode instance) and a list of children (also TreeNode instances).

Ressources

  • SWC Spec
new TreeNode(id: Number, type: Number, x: Number, y: Number, z: Number, r: Number)
Parameters
id (Number) the id of the point
type (Number) type of structure this point comes from (cf. SWC spec)
x (Number) x component of the 3D coordinates
y (Number) y component of the 3D coordinates
z (Number) z component of the 3D coordinates
r (Number) radius at this given point

Boolean: true if this child is already present, false if not
▸ dive(nodeList)

Dive into the TreeNode connection by following the children. Builds a list all along. Stops when a node has no more children (end of branch) or when a node has two children or more because it means it's a forking point. What is returned in the end is an array that can be empty (if end of branch) or with two or more TreeNode instance being the forking direction

dive(nodeList: Array): Array
Parameters
nodeList (Array) contains the previous TreeNode (parent, grand parents, etc.) this array is only pushed to, nothing is taken or read from it.
Returns
Array: of TreeNodes that are forking direction.
